svg.text: Regeneration-Return Frontier & Hearts/Leaves Portfolio Flow Map

g.text: Portfolio Network Effects
Hearts Generation: 2,400 Hearts/month (Care work monetization)
Leaves Generation: 1,800 Leaves/month (150 acres restored/month)
Local Multiplier: 2.3x (vs 1.4x conventional)
Portfolio RoR: 8.4/10 (Integrated impact score)
Key Insights: Regeneration-Return Frontier & Network Effects
Frontier Analysis:
• Regenerative portfolios achieve superior risk-adjusted returns through network resilience
• Bioregional clusters reduce volatility by 15% while maintaining competitive IRR
• RoR integration captures value that conventional analysis misses
• Strong community relationships provide resilience during market stress
Network Value Creation:
• Hearts currency monetizes care work, creating 2.3x local economic multiplier
• Leaves rewards ecological restoration, generating ecosystem service revenue
• Integrated supply chains provide mutual support during disruptions
• Community Investment Trust reinvests profits in network strengthening
Portfolio Advantages:
• Relationship-based risk management vs. financial hedging
• Adaptive capacity through collaborative problem-solving
• Climate resilience through ecological foundation investment
• Social license protection through community sovereignty

svg.text: Source: The Capital Weaver - Chapter 10: Portfolio Design & Risk
